Row.Name: Fantastical
Row.Description: Surprising lands and squiggly rivers. Highly configurable and randomizable.
A globe (technically a cylinder) that wraps East-West.
Row.Name: On

Row.Description: No wrapping, a random aspect ratio, and if the climate is realistic, only one pole.
Row.Name: Off

Row.Description: The map is all one continent, and the only bodies of water are inland seas and lakes.
Row.Name: All Land

Row.Description: No ocean rifts. The map will tend to be navegable via coastal waters.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: One ocean rift. A wrapping map will not be circumnavegable along coastal waters. A non-wrapping map will have an ocean on one of its sides.
Row.Name: One

Row.Description: Two ocean rifts. A wrapping map will have two groups of landmasses separated by ocean tiles. A non-wrapping map will have an ocean on two adjacent sides.
Row.Name: Two

Row.Description: Three ocean rifts. A wrapping map will have three groups of landmasses separated by ocean tiles. A non-wrapping map will be a peninsula.
Row.Name: Three

Row.Description: Four ocean rifts. A wrapping map will have five groups of landmasses separated by ocean tiles. A non-wrapping map will be landmasses in the center surrounded entirely by ocean.
Row.Name: Four

Row.Description: Five ocean rifts. A wrapping map will have seven groups of landmasses separated by ocean tiles. A non-wrapping map will be bounded by ocean with an ocean rift through the center.
Row.Name: Five

Row.Description: Six ocean rifts. A wrapping map will have nine groups of landmasses separated by ocean tiles. A non-wrapping map will be bounded by ocean with two ocean rifts crisscrossing the center.
Row.Name: Six

Row.Description: A random number of ocean rifts.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No continents. Islands will be the only landmasses.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: One continent.
Row.Name: One

Row.Description: Two continents.
Row.Name: Two

Row.Description: Three continents.
Row.Name: Three

Row.Description: Four continents.
Row.Name: Four

Row.Description: Five continents.
Row.Name: Five

Row.Description: Six continents.
Row.Name: Six

Row.Description: Seven continents.
Row.Name: Seven

Row.Description: Eight continents.
Row.Name: Eight

Row.Description: A random number of continents.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No islands.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: Two large islands and three small islands.
Row.Name: Few

Row.Description: Four large islands and seven small islands.
Row.Name: Some

Row.Description: Eight large islands and thirteen small islands.
Row.Name: Many

Row.Description: Sixteen large islands and twenty-one small islands.
Row.Name: Tons

Row.Description: Thirty-two large islands and thirty-three small islands.
Row.Name: Ridiculous

Row.Description: A random number of large and small islands.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Much more coast and land.
Row.Name: Very Low

Row.Description: A little more coast and land.
Row.Name: Low

Row.Description: An Earth-like amount of coast and land.
Row.Name: Standard

Row.Description: A little less coast and land.
Row.Name: High

Row.Description: Much less coast and land.
Row.Name: Very High

Row.Description: A random sea level.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No lakes.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: A few lakes.
Row.Name: Few

Row.Description: Some lakes.
Row.Name: Some

Row.Description: Many lakes.
Row.Name: Many

Row.Description: Tons of lakes.
Row.Name: Tons

Row.Description: A ridiculous number of lakes.
Row.Name: Ridiculous

Row.Description: As many lakes as can fit.
Row.Name: As Many As Possible

Row.Description: A random amount of lakes.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No inland seas.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: One inland sea of roughly 3% of the continent's area.
Row.Name: One Small Sea

Row.Description: Two inland seas of roughly 3% of the continent's area each.
Row.Name: Two Small Seas

Row.Description: Three inland seas of roughly 3% of the continent's area each.
Row.Name: Three Small Seas

Row.Description: One inland sea of roughly 10% of the continent's area.
Row.Name: One Medium Sea

Row.Description: Two inland seas of roughly 10% of the continent's area each.
Row.Name: Two Medium Seas

Row.Description: Three inland seas of roughly 10% of the continent's area each.
Row.Name: Three Medium Seas

Row.Description: One inland sea of roughly half of the continent's area.
Row.Name: One Large Sea

Row.Description: An assortment of three inland seas of random sizes.
Row.Name: Assortment

Row.Description: A random assortment of inland seas or none at all.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Landmasses can extend to the poles.
Row.Name: Yes

Row.Description: Landmasses cannot extend to the poles.
Row.Name: No

Row.Description: Flip a coin to decide if landmasses can extend to the poles.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Climate does not follow latitudes. Nothing prevents poles from being hot and equator from being cold, or snow occuring next to tropical rainforest.
Row.Name: Off

Row.Description: Climate follows latitudes, like a standard map.
Row.Name: On

Row.Description: Flip a coin to decide if the climate follows latitudes.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Region pâté.
Row.Name: Tiny

Row.Description: A nice mash of diced regions, with a few big chunks.
Row.Name: Small

Row.Description: Regions are chunky but not interminable.
Row.Name: Medium

Row.Description: Regions have to be eaten with a knife and fork.
Row.Name: Large

Row.Description: Regions bigger than the plate.
Row.Name: Enormous

Row.Description: Regions are of a random maximum size.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Wider ocean rifts, pointier continents, and fewer islands.
Row.Name: Low

Row.Description: A balance between global nonuniformity and local nonuniformity.
Row.Name: Standard

Row.Description: Skinnier ocean rifts, rounder and snakier continents, and more islands.
Row.Name: High

Row.Description: A random polygonal density.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: A small amount of river-adjacent tiles.
Row.Name: Few

Row.Description: A medium amount of river-adjacent tiles.
Row.Name: Some

Row.Description: A large amount of river-adjacent tiles.
Row.Name: Many

Row.Description: A random amount of river-adjacent tiles.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Many short rivers.
Row.Name: Short/Many

Row.Description: Some medium-length rivers.
Row.Name: Medium/Some

Row.Description: Few long rivers.
Row.Name: Long/Few

Row.Description: A random maximum river length / number of rivers.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: Rivers have no tributaries.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: Rivers are mostly one channel.
Row.Name: Few

Row.Description: Rivers have some tributaries.
Row.Name: Some

Row.Description: Rivers have many tributaries.
Row.Name: Many

Row.Description: A random amount of river forking.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: A quarter of the land is mountainous.
Row.Name: Newest

Row.Description: Large quantities of mountains and hills.
Row.Name: Newer

Row.Description: More mountains and hills.
Row.Name: New

Row.Description: Similar to Earth.
Row.Name: Standard

Row.Description: Fewer mountains and hills.
Row.Name: Old

Row.Description: Almost no mountains or hills.
Row.Name: Older

Row.Description: A random amount of mountains and hills.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No grassland, and very little plains. Ice sheets cover much of the oceans.
Row.Name: Snowball

Row.Description: Very little grassland. No jungle. Larger oceanic ice sheets than standard.
Row.Name: Ice Age

Row.Description: Less grassland than standard.
Row.Name: Cold

Row.Description: Similar to Earth.
Row.Name: Standard

Row.Description: Very little snow, and less tundra than standard.
Row.Name: Warm

Row.Description: No snow, and very little tundra.
Row.Name: Hot

Row.Description: No snow or tundra, and less plains than standard.
Row.Name: Jurassic

Row.Description: Desert and jungle only.
Row.Name: Eocene

Row.Description: A random temperature.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No forest, rainforest, grassland, or plains.
Row.Name: Arrakis

Row.Description: No forest, rainforest, or grassland.
Row.Name: Parched

Row.Description: No forest or rainforest.
Row.Name: Treeless

Row.Description: Less forest and rainforest.
Row.Name: Arid

Row.Description: Similar to Earth.
Row.Name: Standard

Row.Description: Less desert; more forest and rainforest.
Row.Name: Damp

Row.Description: No desert; more forest and rainforest.
Row.Name: Wet

Row.Description: No desert; lots of forest and rainforest.
Row.Name: Drenched

Row.Description: Almost entirely forest and rainforest.
Row.Name: Arboria

Row.Description: A random rainfall.
Row.Name: Random

Row.Description: No roads from previous civilizations.
Row.Name: None

Row.Description: Ancient roads connect the ruins of four cities.
Row.Name: Some

Row.Description: Ancient roads connect the ruins of eight cities.
Row.Name: Many
